item.title: Beocord 9000: Replacing the RAM Battery
item.description:
The Beocord 9000 utilizes a 3V battery to power its 16-word memory chip, an MCM144102, which is described as a peripheral memory unit in the Motorola 6804 manual but lacks readily available detailed specifications. This chip is responsible for storing calibration data and potentially the system time, although further investigation is required. A visual representation of the circuit is included below. A positive aspect of the design is the inclusion of diode D27, which safeguards the battery against reverse polarity connection...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beocord-9000-replacing-the-ram-battery/

item.title: I Know Where You Took Your Pictures Last Summer
item.description:
Eye-Fi, the WiFi-enabled memory card, has introduced a new feature: location tagging. Their latest product, Eye-Fi Explore, automatically adds geotags to photos as you take them. You might be surprised to learn that they haven’t actually included a GPS receiver in the small SD card. Instead, it uses a system that determines location based on known WiFi hotspots. This method covers a significant portion of the U.S. population and major metropolitan areas in Europe...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/i-know-where-you-took-your-pictures-last-summer/
